isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - HEHR POWER SYSTEMS/POWERLINE ALTERNATORS USED ON EMERGENCY VEHICLES - TROUBLESHOOTING - UNDERCHARGED BATTERIES

svcproc.title: UNDERCHARGED BATTERIES
svcproc.para: Undercharged batteries are caused by one or a combination of the following:

step1.para: Loose or missing belts; corroded, broken, loose, or dirty terminals; broken wiring; undersize wiring (2/0 cable recommended); defective batteries.

Wrong pulley ratio for application. Pulley ratio is determined by outside diameter of crankshaft pulley divided by outside diameter of alternator pulley. Most heavy duty applications require a pulley ratio of 2.5 or greater. A ratio of 3.0 is recommended for applications requiring high idle operations.
Current load on system greater than alternator can produce at that engine speed.
Alternator field circuit malfunction caused by one or a combination of the following:

step2.para: Poor contacts between regulator and brushes.
Poor connection between slip ring assembly and field (rotor) coil leads.
Rotor coil shorted, open, or grounded.
Alternator may have lost its magnetism. Full field the alternator. See how to full field a Series 25 alternator in Section 3.

step1.para: Alternator generating section malfunction caused by one or combination of the following:

step2.para: Stator phase(s) shorted, open, or grounded.
